Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sharon P
Reviews.Content: What a fantasic place to stay. They have the largest suites on the airport strip. Very well kept. I will stay there everytime i'm in the area. They have the most comfortable beds and pillows. The front desk is very friendly and helpful. I felt very welcomed. Everyone seems very happy to be there too.

Reviews.Title: “A+”
Reviews.Author: karen m
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Quality in March for a group function hotel was clean the staff was receptive and the restaurant has amazing salad’s. Bar was open past 10pm and its fully stocked, it was a great place to have a drink after a long day of dry meetings.

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTINGLY DIRTY AND DISAPPOINTING (save your money/stay next door at the Travel Lodge)”
Reviews.Author: pgrobitaille
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a King bed Suite in September on the 11th floor and where overwhelmed with the quality and beautifully designed room (I guess this floor had recently been renovated previous to our visit) We loved our stay for 4 days. We returned in March, booked a two queen bedroom suite and couldnt believe that we were in the same hotel as September! The room was on the 5th floor and was dirty everywhere, we sat on the bed and the whole frame broke in two as soon as we got into the room, when we expressed our concern to the front desk, they gave us keys to two other two bed suited on the sixth floor, same experience, spilled pop all over the walls as we entered, the fridge was covered in crumbs, the table and chairs were full of food from previous visitors, the tub was chipped all over-we couldnt tell if it was dirt or chips at least 20 on its bottom (we didnt dare touch to find out) the coffee tables still had dirty rings all over it from coffee or pop cans...the windows were filthy, the wall paper on the walls were torn away and ripped off the walls here and there, all the baseboards had little paint left on them...showing all the filth of dirtyness...the carpeting and furniture all looked like a hockey team just finished a heck of a good party all over them...very dirty! We did not take a room this time around and wont return or recommed staying here, its gross. A totally different experience than last September in a single suite which was much larger, much cleaner, newer and much more polished for less money....ZERO CONSISTANCY HERE! I re-buke my first review made in September for this establishment after seeing the lower floor 2-bed suites.......YUCK! $149.00 Plus Tax ........dont waste your money...go next door to the Travel Lodge...its clean, large rooms and much newly updated with a great coffee bar and restaurant and we paid $30.00 less for the room..now thats nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service Once Again”
Reviews.Author: chanty777
Reviews.Content: This has been my second stay at this hotel and once again they have gone above and beyond my expectations. The check in staff were extremely friendly and quick. Every staff member I encountered through out my stay had a smile and seemed to really enjoy what they do. I had the chance to meet the General Manager when my key didn't work, he had personally walked me up to my room to ensure that I entered without issue and I thought this was a great gesture on his part. Dinner in Grafittis was Excellent. I have never had food so hot arrive at my table and it was very delicious. My room was very spacious and bright. The king size bed was extremely comfortable and I slept very well. I will definitely be coming back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: latinmodel19
Reviews.Content: I've been to this hotel twice already and my experience has always been excellent. the rooms are in very good condition, spacious and very clean. the staff is very nice and always willing to help. the location is great, transit accessible and very close to the airport. i'd definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “It's gone downhill”
Reviews.Author: awdizzle
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in this hotel before prior to a business trip, when the opportunity came again to take advantage of a park and fly this was a first choice. While the park and fly function is fantastic, the accomodations this time around were not satisfactory. The shuttle bus is fast and free, made perfect sense. Got the last spot in the parking tower which made it easier to get down (elevator). Drop off, pick up was fine. No concerns there. 330am pickup was within 5 minutes. The accomodations on the other hand, dreadful. The telephone agent indicated a continental breakfast which was not available. We did have a suite which was of great size. Had we stuck around, it's a good room. The facilities were not up to snuff though. The bedding was stale and hard. Either it had not been used in some time, or it was suffering from a lack of fabric softener. Comforter had holes in it, and there as hair all over the place. A smoke butt was clearly visible on the bathroom floor. The bathtub did not drain whatsoever, filling up during a shower and remaining at that level until we left. The walls were covered in mildew and mold was present. The hallway carpet was pungent to say the least. The room was very quiet considering it's location. We only stayed about 5 hours start to finish ; Slept little, and decided to bolt it home. When checking out, made mention of the bathtub to the attendant who seemingly did not care. Merely grinned without concern. If this has been renovated, I'm surprised. It was not sufficient at all and was a great surprise considering what I remembered. Would certainly look at alternative accomodations for our next park and fly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: Muhammad N
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the 11th floor. The best part of my stay was this hotel has all suite type category having two rooms in all the rooms seperated by french doors. The washroom was very spacious. The front desk service was by the best I have ever received from any hotel. My dinner experience at the Graffiti's was even more wonderful. The food was great. I had to leave early for the airport the following morning and I had asked the wait staff to rush my order. He was not only quick but he made sure he looked after me. Great Job ! Quality Suites Toronto Airport staff members

Reviews.Title: “Shabby”
Reviews.Author: Brenda M
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this location previously and was satisfied which is why I returned. When I arrived this year the double room I booked was not needed so when I told them at the desk they were glad to be able to offer a double to another guest as they had none available. They offered me an upgrade(??????!!!!!!!!). It was truly a downgrade. The room was disgusting and the bathroom was in very poor condition. I know I could have requested another room but apparently they were in short supply and I knew someone else would have been put in there anyway. Very disappointed in cleanliness of a Hotel of this reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: FoxT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as an overnight between flights; did not use the restaurant or parking,but the shuttle service and the front desk staff were very pleasant and courteous. The rooms were very large,clean and well appointed,the bed was very comfortable,and it was quiet with no other room , traffic or plane noise. The rooms could use an update because they are showing their age. Would definitely stay here again. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Poor experience”
Reviews.Author: James2559
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Quality Suites near the airport in early February 2012. We booked this hotel because of the park and fly options and were extremely disappointed with our stay. The family suite was very dated, the beds were old and sunk in the middle, the comforter had holes in it and the bathroom was disgusting. The sink was not clean, there was an old bath tub stopper with mold on it and dirt marks on the walls and doors. Upon our return from our trip, we found out the shuttle bus was operated by a third party company that serviced many airport hotels and upon the bus arriving, my wife and I and 3 small kids were told they were full and would have to wait 30 minutes for the next one. Not a good experience with kids. This is definately not a hotel I plan on staying at in the future.

Reviews.Title: “rooms are almost too big!!!”
Reviews.Author: decarmomichael
Reviews.Content: I was there for a work conference and had to stay over night one night and i can't get over the size of the guest rooms.....They call them suites and have king ( i think it was king) it was big in the bed room and then a set of private doors that goes into another room nice living room type room. makes me wonder why i paid 475k for my tiny condo lol . They have a place to eat but i never got the chance to try it out but if being busy is an indicator i'd say the food was likely good. Our meeting was catered and the food was good.... over all i have no complaints nice place i'll be sure to share with friends! Thanks

Reviews.Title: “1 Really good room, 1 not so good.”
Reviews.Author: VTXGirl66
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Suites on February 10, 2012 before flying out to the DR and again on the 18th on our return. First room was 404 and was not very good. First was the smell of pot in the halls, but when we mentioned it to the front staff on our way out for dinner, they must have done something because it wasn't there when we came back. That room is very dated, the couch's cushions were completely flat and pushed into the couch, there was a stain that I hope was ketchup on the bedroom curtains, and several stains on the walls in the bathroom. For the Suites, I was very disappointed. Room 414 on the way back was what I expected. Very clean, furniture in good condition, and as always, front staff very friendly. The main complaint would be the coffee in room. They provide only 1 pkg of regular and 1 pkg of decaf. We paid for a double room, and since they are single serve packages, you would think you could have 2 of each for choices. Then, we could both have a cup of our preferred in the morning. Next time I will ask for extra when we check in, but after flying back in, I had forgotten. The location, transfer to the airport, parking, all of that makes it an excellent choice, and when doing the stay, park, fly package, you can't beat the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great room for the price”
Reviews.Author: Joey L
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, good rates and free parking. The french doors separating the king size bed and the rest of room created some nice privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel near airport”
Reviews.Author: Marilyn42
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms here last Monday as our son was flying from Vancouver to PEI with a stopover in Toronto. We had the executive floor and used a CARP Zoomer # to get a very good rate. The rooms were very spacious and clean. We had friends come over to visit so the living room area was great for a visit, and could put the baby to bed in the bedroom. The new 32" TV is in the bedroom, while the living area has an old TV with a very fuzzy picture. Not that much of a concern, as we only watched it in the next morning. We did notice a very strong smoke smell in the elevator, but if a guest is so inconsiderate as to smoke in the elevator, management can't be blamed. Obviously, they can't stand outside the elevators all day to catch the culprit. I suppose they could check during the night to see if any need airing out. Shuttle service was fine, but interesting note -- the male driver helped with the luggage, while the female driver on the return trip ignored the pile of luggage at the curb and simply got in the vehicle! The Keg is right across the road and walking distance, but very crowded even on a Monday night. Would certainly stay here again in we need a hotel near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Best place for us pre-trip.”
Reviews.Author: sandytoez
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice now before our annual trip to the sunny south and is our best choice for the Stay and Fly package they offer. Location is so convenient, close to the airport and right across the road from The Keg. We visit the bar downstairs afterwards for an evening cocktail. The covered parking garage for our car is a huge plus. The rooms are cosy clean and comfy. The TV's are old and small but who cares? Shuttle service was dependable. See you next year. Judy and Chris.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome back”
Reviews.Author: freeflyerz
Reviews.Content: This is the second time i have stayed with the quality suites. the first time was a few years ago. as soon as i arrived i felt welcomed by the staff. when i mentioned i had stayed before they we very receptive to hear my feed back. i am very impressed by the hotel and will definitely stay here again and again! i was told that the restaurant has a new menu and i believe it. the food was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Steven B
Reviews.Content: The rooms at Quality Suites were a pleasant surprise .....they are above what I expected when compared with other hotels of the same level. It's like they should be rated one star higher. Steve B.

Reviews.Title: “Right Price, Poor Value.”
Reviews.Author: michiganpete7
Reviews.Content: Proximity to airport and major attractions are the only attractive features of this hotel. The suites are good size, but outdated. My bed was rock hard, as were the pillows. And even though my suite was non-smoking, stepping off the elevator onto the 11th floor left no mistake this hotel is not smoke-free. If you need a budget hotel, I suppose you get what you pay for. But if you're a business traveler, there are many other options available in the greater Toronto area that offer a better stay.

Reviews.Title: “not so great”
Reviews.Author: atraveller57
Reviews.Content: The room was on the non smoking floor and it was still very smoky. Breakfast was horrible and not included. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Big mistake believing positive reviews”
Reviews.Author: sarchar02
Reviews.Content: Terrible hotel. Booked on phone and asked 3 separate times that the parking would be included - explaining we were gone 12 days. Assured they were included in the exorbitant price of $134 (craziness for the poor shape of this hotel). Of course, when we got there were told only 8 days included and it was $10/day after that. We had paid $134 for a crap hotel because we wanted parking included and now they wanted to charge us another $40. When I tried to talk to the very surly and rude check in receptionist she wouldn't look me in the eye and kept yammering on and on and on, saying the same thing over and over again, talking over me. Finally I told her, stop saying the same thing over again and tell me how we can fix this! Then she got even more rude. Brutal. She said she'd have to call her manager "at home" to get approval. I figured after I confronted her she wouldn't bother but she did and we were told the 4 days would be comped (which is what we were told would be the case in the first place!). After all this the room was DISGUSTING!!! This is not an exaggeration. You can see my attached photos. There was leftover takeaway and someone's can of caffeine free Diet Pepsi in the mini fridge, there was hair in the tub, an enormous, disgusting black, moldy hole in the bathroom sink, something splattered all down the one door. Not to mention the wallpaper was all stripped and hanging at the top in the hallway. Oh, and internet will cost you $14.95 - even though I heard the receptionist tell the gentleman before us that it was free and there were no passwords needed. NO idea what the positive reviews are about but I would stay as far away from this hotel as you possibly can.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Quality Suites”
Reviews.Author: TravelSabs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a night here before catching an earling morning flight from the airport. We were pleansantly surprised how clean and spacious the room was. This hotel is really close to the airport and the shuttle comes every half an hour running 24 hours a day. Not only is the hotel close to the airport but also close to restaurants (if you want to grab a nice dinner in the evening). We had a great experience here and would stay here again next time we are flying out of Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “beware of parking charges”
Reviews.Author: elycee
Reviews.Content: I recently attended two days of business meetings at this hotel. Able to find parking but all the signs indicated only overnight hotel or restaurant guests get free parking. So I paid the $15 daily maximum. After I found out parking was included for meeting attendees they refused to refund my money. Spotty service - soup from the first day's lunch was still on the table on the morning of the second day - all congealed of course. They line their potato salad bowl with an upside-down plate to make it look fuller..... curious practice. Why not use a smaller bowl if they don't want to provide more food.... the pizzas looked like they were dry from being over cooked when reheating from a frozen state - no way they were made fresh. Some colleagues who stayed there were happy with their rooms. Guess it was my unlucky week....

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: journeygirl2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference last month. My suite was in excellent condition, with some newer features and very clean. I had no trouble getting a convenient parking spot even though the hotel was full. Management team members Tony and Mike were excellent in saving me a room for an extra night although I didn't end up needing it. Thanks to all for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel with free parking”
Reviews.Author: happytravellor4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Quality Inn in order to catch an early morning flight. What attracted us was their reasonable prices, the proximity to the airport, an airport shuttle and free parking for 7 days. We were unsure what to expect but were more than pleasantly surprised. The staff members were friendly, but still professional; the room was clean and the bed was comfortable. We had to leave too early to enjoy the free breakfast but there was coffee and muffins available for us while we waited for the shuttle. When we returned, they arrived promptly after our call to return us to the hotel to get our car. Overall, it was an excellent experience and we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional stay!”
Reviews.Author: Brigette S
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of spending a few nights at the hotel. The staff were exceptional! My room was clean and I was greeted by the room attendant, the hotel was well kept and Graffitis restaurant was great! Food was good and the service was very nice. It was a pleasure to have experienced Employees that love their job and are so happy to deal with the Guests.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Surprise”
Reviews.Author: crystew
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent booked this hotel for us to use the day before we travel to Jamaica. We travelled from Sudbury on the 7th of October as we were flying out at 7:30 am on the 8th of October. We received a package deal where we could leave our car in their garage for 7 nights and pick it up when we flew back on the 15th. All for a price of $89.00 plus taxes. We arrived around 7 after a 4 hour drive leaving right from our 8.5 hour shifts at work. The front staff were fantastic and very fast as well as efficient...(took roughly 10 minutes). We opened the door to our room to find a very clean, neat Suite. A large sitting area with a sofa, chair and TV armoir. There was a very large desk with a window view, office chair and 2 dining chairs. There were French doors leading into a room with a king bed and a flat screen tv. Off the bedroom was a closet and vanity table with a door to the large bathroom. This was a jack and jill bathroom with access to the sitting area which also had a wet bar area with a coffee maker, fridge and sink. When we checked out in the morning they gave us 4 passes for the Airport shuttle two to use on the way there and 2 for when we came back. Checkout took us all of 5 minutes and the shuttle was there within 10 minutes. When we arrived back on the 15th we only waited 15 minutes and the shuttle was there to drive us to the hotel. We picked up our car and were on our way home within 1/2 hour after we cleared customs..This is a hotel we will continue to use even for our quick weekend shopping and entertainment trips to Toronot. Checkout in the morni

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn C
Reviews.Content: Staff very friendly and accommodating, always smiling. Suites spacious, quiet and clean. Graffitis restaurant was nice to have in the hotel, for breakfast and dinner. Would definitely stay again, thank you Quality Suites for your hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Overall great stay!”
Reviews.Author: KingstonSunshine
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Quality Suites Toronto Airport while attending a conference in the area and was blown away by the level of star service by every employee I came in contact with. Not to mention how clean my room and all the public areas were. I also ate in the on site restaurant a couple of times for both breakfast and dinner and was very impressed with the quality of food and again, the excellent service. Next time I travel to the airport area of Toronto, I will definitely make a point of staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay. Great Service.”
Reviews.Author: Sharon M
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Quality Suites Toronto Airport recently and I was very impressed with this hotel and most of all their service. My room was large, comfortable and very clean. Bed was fantastic. On site restaurant was great, good food and fabulous service. I will definately stay again. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “"This Hotel Rocks"”
Reviews.Author: Michelle M
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fantastic Experience!!! Front desk staff top of the line, extremely courteous, professional and always smiling-keep up the great work ladies ;) Check-in and check-out very speedy. Room was very spacious, clean and bed was very comfortable, lots of pillows nice and fluffy - "when my head hit the pillow I was out like a light". Housekeeping staff very efficient - also great job!!! Graffitis restaurant service and food AWESOME. Thank you for making my stay a positive memorable experience :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff!”
Reviews.Author: paulci
Reviews.Content: I have not had the opportunity to stay at this hotel since my last visit of about 12 years ago. Amazingly, I recognized some of the staff from my last stay. Everyone I encountered over my 3 days & nights there were very welcoming and accommodating. The one glitch I experienced - On day of arrival I was trying to reach room service and couldn't get through. As I had a lot of paperwork to do that night I thought I would to go to the restaurant, order there and ask that it be delivered up to my room. About to exit my room I met (Darville, I believe is his name) who was making deliveries to the guest rooms. When I explained that I couldn't get through to room service he took my order on the spot and dinner was delivered within 20 minutes. The food was really great to go along with this excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: chanty777
Reviews.Content: From the moment I walked in the front door I received nothing less than excellent service. The front desk always smiled when I came in and greeted me every time. The room was clean, quiet and the bed was very comfortable. I really enjoyed the vanity where I was able to sit and get ready. Graffiti's pizza was very tasty. I do not have anything negative to say about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk staff was great”
Reviews.Author: Gt1234
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff was very helpful. I will always stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Most EXCELLENT Value for your money!”
Reviews.Author: pgrobitaille
Reviews.Content: If your looking to stretch your buck, Quality Suites 262 Carlingview Drive, Toronto is the place to go! Huge spacious suites with separate bedroom, very clean and efficient (offering a sofa, full size table with chairs, mini refrigerator and everything else you can think of including a sitee counter with chair and large mirror for the ladies who enjoy taking time to put on make-up, no sharing the bathroom here! Clean and pleasant rooms, this hotel offers excellent pricing, great service and is very easy to find. You really cant go wrong here if your looking for a comfortable, clean and quiet place to stay while your away from home, Quality Suites provides a nesting place you wont want to leave! Thanks Quality Suites for making our stay so pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Mikicino
Reviews.Content: Rooms are quite clean and large, service is good as the price. Our room had a bad smoking smell even if we requested a non smoking room. Anyway is a good value hotel for people that has low budget and want to visit Toronto by car (25 minutes driving)

Reviews.Title: “spacious but just okay otherwise”
Reviews.Author: olddaughter
Reviews.Content: We booked this for it's location near a family event but were surprised by the actual cost for parking ($18 for the night) - the parking lot was not even 1/3 full. There was a night security guard on duty for the lot and the outdoors of the hotel. The 'room' was spacious - actually was set up like a batchelor suite - with french doors separating the 'master'/king bed area from the queen bed and queen sofa pull-out and living/dining areas. The bathroom had 2 doors - one leading into the master area and the other into the common living/dining area - we found this convenient too. The king & queen beds were comfortable & the linens were impeccably clean. Never tried the sofa pull-out. However, one of the french doors and one of the bathroom doors had hinges coming loose (bit difficult to close). Overall the furniture was looking worn. Very little noise from the halls or outside, and really good light-blocking curtains - so we all had a good sleep. Also appreciated was that the staff allowed us a later check-out without charging extra (we had arrived very late the night before).

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise - Much Appreciated”
Reviews.Author: JoTraveller
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting much last night when we were shuttled over to this hotel from Toronto airport with a voucher. Things with airline had not gone well and we were cranky and exhausted. This hotel was nice and clean and the suite layout was really cute. We had mints on our pillows and while there was a little suggestion of wear to the hotel, it was clean and we slept well. For the 4 hours or so we were there. All in all, bad airline, nice hotel. Thank you, Quality Suites Toronto Airport!

Reviews.Title: “Stay, park and fly deal worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Loveculture
Reviews.Content: My family stayed one night in a suite. We were 2 adults and 1 teenager. There was a double bed in the living room and a king size bed in the bedroom. The room is quiet and comfortable. There is a seperate mirror area for makeup, instead of in the bathroom. The parking is covered and secure. The shuttle runs every 30 minutes 24 hours a day. 10 minute ride to terminal 1.

Reviews.Title: “Gets better every year!”
Reviews.Author: newbruns99
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice, a year apart for a business conference. It was even better this year as updates have been made in many of the rooms. The food and the service were superb. The two small concerns I had (a parking ticket on my car and an unpleasent smelll in the room) were both addressed promptly. Suggestions were very well received and the management responded positivly and I was quite impressed with both the staff and management. Looking forward to a return to the stay same time next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families or friends travelling together.”
Reviews.Author: reelman59
Reviews.Content: My wife, son, and I stayed at this hotel as a stopover before flying out of the country, and again upon returning. All staff were friendly and courteous. Check-in was problem free. The 2 room suite was very spacious, bright, quiet, and clean. A wet bar, fridge, microwave, and coffee maker are included. There is a flat screen tv in each bedroom, and and an entrance to the bathroom from each room. The rooms are separated by beautiful double french doors for privacy. It's a more economical option than booking 2 separate rooms to accommodate everyone. For some reason, the on-site restaurant doesn't offer room service on weekends, but does during the week. The free internet service in the main lobby was a plus, as well as the free airport shuttle service, and on-site convenience store/gift shop. We will definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the value, nothing to complain about”
Reviews.Author: kgreen12
Reviews.Content: i stayed here as i was passing thru on my way back for a trip , im a travel agent and was granted an upgrade for my stay ... i met with the manager a short time before my stay and she said they have renovated some stuff , the check in was nice the hotel is close to the airport with an airport shuttle, but also it can be reached by local bus system from downtown toronto... i had a bathroom 1 bedroom and living room sweet on one of the top floors it was a great value rooms were done in good taste and bed was comfy and they had a welcome basket with some treats and drinks for free, also there was a resturant onsite and there was a walmart and shopping complex up the street from there , there is an office space to do on line check in and check email etc, a good value for an overnight stay and awating to go to the airport

Reviews.Title: “No thrill, just a regular suite.”
Reviews.Author: isaruya05
Reviews.Content: We made a last minute booking on the unpublished price list for almost half the regular rate. The initial greeting with the clerk was somewhat ambiguous. As she welcomed us, she made no eye contact. The room was quite spacious, as it is a suite. Nothing fancy, just a carbon copy of our collective imagination of what a hotel room should be. A light smell of damp carpet, worn furniture, analogue televisions, etc. Be aware: NEVER get any room on the second floor because its located near the gym room. If someone decide to jog on the treadmill, the structural foundation does not block the sound it makes or absorb the vibration. IT IS LOUD! PARKING is 15$ per night. FREE INTERNET is only available in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Meetings”
Reviews.Author: ronhillsubzero
Reviews.Content: The staff is great to work with, very friendly and professional. Third year for the meetings and I couldn't ask for more. Great food Great Staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great sleep, great food”
Reviews.Author: marsha30
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the hotel to check in there was 4 people in front of me. Although there was only 1 person working the desk he made eye contact with me and smiled. John was very polite and I had no issues upon check in. The room was HUGE and I slept very well in the king bed, i did have some concern regarding the planes but they didn`t keep me awake at all. I was at the hotel for a week and the woman (Brenda) who cleaned my room would always smile and ask how I was doing if she saw me in the hall. This was very nice. Graffitis food was awsome!!! I ate there on 3 occasions and had room service once. Great portions and the pastas were fantastic!!! The only thing that did happen during my stay was the fire alarm went off around 1 am the one morning. There was only one person working the desk and there was a young man in the lobby letting people know what was happening. I had the choice to return to my room via stairs or wait until the elevators were up. This was an uncontrable situation and was handled fine. That won`t keep me away from the amazing room, food and service!

Reviews.Title: “"We couldn't have been happier with our stay"”
Reviews.Author: cokie59
Reviews.Content: Thanks to all the staff for providing us with a PERFECT visit! We couldn't have asked for better accomodations, service or food! Will we be back?: ABSOLUTELY!

Reviews.Title: “Caring people”
Reviews.Author: wldwilly
Reviews.Content: I love staying at hotels where the staff looks after you. This is certainly is the case at this hotel. I had one issue and the GM looked after it personally with professional exuberance!

Reviews.Title: “"Can't wait til next time"”
Reviews.Author: nanckea
Reviews.Content: After a very long drive up the 400 we were thrilled with arriving at the hotel. Checking in was painless and quick so we were in our room with no hassle at all. With so many eating places nearby to choose from we went out for a quick supper. When we got back to our room the room had been made ready for some sleep time. We were very happy that to squeeze everything in that we had planned for the weekend that the hotel had a very nice and well presented continental breakfast which was great. Upon returning to our room after being out for the full day we were very pleased that our room was in order and we were ready for some more sleeping. Thank you for taking such great care of us and making our weekend totally enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back, Staff disinterested”
Reviews.Author: sweethome
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnght on a business trip, needed a clean room with a good sleep for an all day meeting the next day. First time staying at this hotel. Reservation and checkin were ok, but there was no review of reservation information and checkin was brisk and impersonal, going through the motions, not particularly welcoming. Here is the lowdown: The Good: -big room, reasonably clean, -good price $109 considering Bollywood was in town -ice machine worked -ac worked -beds comfy The bad: -fire alarm at 1:00 am, stood outside for 1/2 hour, no staff anywhere informing guest what is going on, returned to the lobby, front desk clerk working on computer as if nothing is happening, everybody up moving around the halls and couldn't get back to sleep for another hour. -a/c noisy --shower control defective - even Arnie would have trouble terminating the flow -no ironing board, called down and one was located with 30 minutes, so pretty good response on this item, but how can cleaning staff miss that -old tube tvs with poor reception -checkout was impersonal, no mention of fire alarm, more interested in knowing whether i had the bill under the door (didn't) no asking if i enjoyed the stay, etc. -charge for parking -carpeting stained, bath fixtures worn out All in all underwhelming and better choices along the airport strip for a few bucks more.

Reviews.Title: “Time to take more care cleaning the washrooms!”
Reviews.Author: GarsonGroup
Reviews.Content: I am so disugusted at what we found in our washroom. After we checked in I used the washroom. All was fine until I went to flush - on the top of the toilet lid, there was a substantial amount of hair clippings. It was terrible! Not really sure how the cleaning staff could have missed that amount of hair. I called reception and they reluctantly offered switch my room. I was exhausted after a long drive and asked them to bring a luggae cart up when they brought the new key up. Needless the say, the luggage cart never came. There was no apology at all for the state of the bathroom. In addtion, I have never heard back after I submitted a complaint on their website. I specifically asked for a response and offered to send them a picture of the toilet lid. I have stayed at many, many hotels and can honestly say I have never found anything as disgusting as this and along with it such a lack of response from the hotel staff and management. No matter what price you get on the hotel room, it sure isn`t worth discovering what I did.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay.. wouldnt recommend room service.”
Reviews.Author: Maha87
Reviews.Content: My friends and i booked this hotel for a convention..This hotel was fine at first. we entered the room, it was clean and tidy.. very spacious. but when we used the washroom, the sink kept leaking from under which made it rather unappealing and forced us to put towels under it. Also, the room service with this hotel was awful. we had room service three times. the first time,we specifically told them no ham, yet they added it in anyway. we also found hair in TWO of our plates which is horrible!. the time it was served was rather quick though. also, the second time we had room service for breakfast, it included ham once again.. so when i called them up to tell them, they decided to yell at me over the phone telling me i was mistaken by reading the menu wrong. (when clearly the meal didnt say it included ham what so ever) so i had to go downstairs and show it to them myself.. either way.. the stay i must say was average. considering the suites are very spacious and the house keeping did an excellent job. but when it comes to room service, i honestly would recommend to look elsewhere. finding hair and having people yell at you is really not a thrill. luckily the manager of the restaurant gave us free burgers to accommodate.. but in all honesty, the food wasn't worth all that hassle.. i wouldn't have room service from there ever again and i highly recommend travelers to look elsewhere for food.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, very large rooms”
Reviews.Author: Electriques
Reviews.Content: I loved the size of the room at this hotel - it was a suite with a separate living area. The room itself was fine, the linens were decent and it was clean. No issues with noise. There is no wireless Internet in the rooms and the high speed should be called no speed. Because of the wired connection only one person can connect at a time. The from desk staff on duty when we arrived were hopelessly slow with a poor attitude Other we saw during the week were better. The gym equipment is very outdated Be careful of extra charges - $6.00 for airport shuttle, $15.00 for parking, $15.00 for a fridge in the room, $10+ for breakfast. All in all I really liked the hotel because of the large rooms. This is a bonus when you spend a lot of time in hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Be very careful about extra charges if you book via Hotwire”
Reviews.Author: brianinvan
Reviews.Content: The hotel was basic, and *might* be fine overall for a cheap overnight stay. My issue is that the hotel website states very clearly that there's a free shuttle to/from Pearson, where in practice the hotel does a "bait and switch". When I got my monthly credit card statement, I saw a charge for $12 ($6x2) from the hotel. I called and was told that it is a charge for the shuttle to the airport from the hotel because I booked via Hotwire. Apparently it's still free to take the shuttle from Pearson to the hotel, but the hotel charges you to go the other way. I told the hotel that no one ever told me there would be such a charge, but all I got was the canned response "That's our deal with Hotwire". I called Hotwire and they had never heard of this additional charge. Hotwire ended up offering me a credit for the shuttle charge, and I contested the charge with my credit card company. Make sure you ask the hotel about extra charges or you may be surprised at a later point, when the hotel is unwilling to do anything about it.

Reviews.Title: “EXcellent, EXcellent and Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Vivacious1025
Reviews.Content: Stayed there because we needed to catch an early morning flight and parked the car for a week. The parking was overcrowded and couldn't find a parking spot. I reported to the desk and an agent came right after she checked-in a guest and moved her parking spot for me. I was very impressed!! Then I went to the restaurant on the ground floor for a late dinner, the food was great and it wasn't very expensive! I had a very comfortable bed and it was a king-size! Eventhough, I didn't need a suite for a short stay, I believe they are all suites hotels. With the price that I paid, the park and staying package that I had and the service I had experienced, it was extremely excellent! I would recommend this hotel to my friends and colleagues if they ask me about park and fly hotel in the airport area.

Reviews.Title: “Seemed nice & clean, far from downtown TO, no free breakfast”
Reviews.Author: thisfridaythe13th
Reviews.Content: This hotel has mostly friendly front desk staff. The employee who checked me in, and one who checked me out, were both very friendly and pleasant. The hotel has ample parking even though it had a sign signaling limited parking. I did not have a problem parking. My room was clean, comfortable, and nice looking. It was very loud in the hallway from 10pm on, but I didn't bother contacting the front desk. It didn't end up interupting my sleep. The beds are very very firm, and hard. The pillows are slim, kind of tough, and firm as opposed to big, fluffy and soft. I had trouble sleeping, and wished I'd brought my own pillow with me. There is no fridge, or microwave, which was not a huge issue, but I prefer to have that in my room. I used the hotel guide, from the desk in my room, to locate vending machines. I found the one on my floor was out of order, and ended up going to 5 different floors before finding a vending machine. Each floor that listed a machine didn't really have one. I found a machine on 2, i think it was floor 2, and the vending machine was empty but the drink machine was full. The drink machine has gatorate, and lipton, and water, no soda, and is very expensive. There was no free breakfast, and no continental breakfast at all. On the hotel's website they have a muffin symbol which indicates a continental breakfast. It'd be one thing to find out there is a charge attatched to the breakfast, but as a staff member told me in the morning "there is no continental breakfast". There was a restaurant menu for breakfast, and a buffet for $10. I was told, by a staff member, to go to the front desk to somehow get free breakfast vouchers that people had gotten. My mom went to the desk and came back empty handed. We ended paying $20 for breakfast at Perkins a few miles away. The computer in the business center was easy to access, right off the lobby, and comfortable, with a glass door that can close for privacy, but only one computer. The lobby is nice looking. I was able to book this choice hotel with points, so that it was free. I felt that for a free hotel room it was fine, but I was so bummed out over the breakfast mixup, and location(which i'll get to), that I would have been better off paying for a different hotel. The hotel is near the airport, so it might be fine for people flying in for a night. If you are spending time down town, at the Air Canada Center, the TIFF, AGO, or anything like that, you're way better off getting something located downtown. I was led to believe this hotel was a short distance, but it took forever, with heavy traffic, to get there from downtown, a 15 minute drive took, I'd say 45 minutes-over an hour at times. You have to leave really early if you have someplace to be at a specific time. So basically if you're passing through and need a place to stay, this would be an okay option except for the lack of free breakfast, and no help from that with the staff, but if you going to be spending time in Toronto, then stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fantastic value for my dollar”
Reviews.Author: joenash
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed there before we left on our honeymoon, it was our first time at a Quality, and it definitely will not be the last. any town we visit and we need to stay at a hotel, this will be our first choice and will be disappointed if there is not one in the town - the front desk staff were very friendly and very helpful - very clean halls and rooms - wife found the bed a little hard, it was good for me - airport shuttle quick and on time - 8 days of covered parking for free, thx Plain and simple unbeatable value for the money thank you very much!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for a good sleep, not for luxury.”
Reviews.Author: Stan_Cooper
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Quality Suites regularly between business trips, and I am satisfied with my experience there. I find that despite a cross-section of travelers who stay at the hotel, it is always quiet. I even stayed there on New Year's Eve and did not hear a peep from my neighbours. The decor in the rooms is getting a bit run down, but it is always clean and comfortable. I do enjoy having a suite to spread out a bit rather than being stuck in a small room. The fitness center is pretty small. My experience with the staff at this hotel has always been positive. Although I don't mind it, I must say I notice a bit of an odour in the hallways on the second and third floor sometimes. It smells to me like people smoking weed in the stairwells maybe? I'm not sure though, it seems unusual that it would happen on a recurring basis... I didn't think there were smoking rooms on those floors, but I'm not sure about that either.

Reviews.Title: “We recommend it for top notch value, hospitality, quality & convenience.”
Reviews.Author: Honduras38
Reviews.Content: Our building brigade of 11 volunteers stayed overnight at the Quality Suites Toronto Airport on the night of October 28, 2010 on our way to Nuevo Paraiso, Honduras to build a much needed kindergarten room onto a tiny country school with no electricity and outside toilets. We left our vehicles at the Quality Suites, free of charge, in indoor parking for the 12 days we were away. We had to catch a 6:00 AM flight and the airport shuttle was on time, as was the shuttle back to our vehicles on our return. The Sales Manager gave us a special rate for volunteer groups, looked after all our needs in a professional manner, and was delightful to deal with. The whole experience with Quality Suites Toronto Airport was top notch.

Reviews.Title: “exceptional front end staff and exceptional service in the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: schnoobs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I only stay here when we travel abroad, which is at least twice a year. The front end staff has always exceeded our expections with their friendliness and help. On one occasion the gentleman at the front desk actually walked us all the way to the Subway food store so we wouldn't get lost! If that isn't going above and beyond I don't know what is!! The restaurant is the same with their service, very friendly and also gave me free coffee to take back to our room when I forgot my wallet. We use to stay at the Terminal 3 hotel in the airport but it was almost $300 a night and we found that we enjoyed and slept just as well in the beds at the Quality Suites for half the price. We look forward to our stay here everytime we fly out of Toronto. Don't look anywhere else!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stop-Over Hotel”
Reviews.Author: warrenandlinda
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on the stay-park-fly package. An excellent value, especially if you have an early morning flight like we did. The extended parking is on-site, a definite bonus. Shuttle to and from the airport was punctual. The hotel room was clean and comfortable. Overall, a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, comfort and convenience”
Reviews.Author: Ajax44
Reviews.Content: We had an early morning flight so we checked in the evening before. The front desk was courteous, arranged a shuttle to the airport for us and assured us that our car would be safe in their parking lot until our return. We had a wonderful dinner in the restaurant and our room was very comfortable and spacious. The hotel was perfect as it is located less than 5 minutes from the airport and they provided parking and a free shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Revisited-Update to my Previous Post”
Reviews.Author: malomotts
Reviews.Content: This is an update from our recent stay at the Quality Suites Toronto Airport on Carlingview as we decided to give them another shot after I was contacted very swiftly by management after writing my recent unfavorable review. Everyone went above and beyond what we expected. From the front-desk, to house-keeping, to the executive department- everyone was simply outstanding! We appreciate the warm and hospitable services that we received while we were at the Quality Suites this time around. My father was especially impressed and that was important to us since we were celebrating his 71st birthday. We received a wonderful gift basket from management to help celebrate my dad's birthday. It made it that much more memorable! We realize that what happened on our trip last year may have only been a fluke, so it was nice to get a second chance to experience it better. It is so hard when you plan a vacation for months that you want to make sure everything is OK with all of the other preparations- especially when traveling with young kids or older people on a limited time-frame. The hotel is the last issue you want to think about. It should be the place to go for stress-free relaxation after a long day of running around with the family. Sometimes, you remember the hotel as much as the vacation-this is one of those times. Our stay at the Quality Suites was stress-free, comfortable and clean. We appreciate their reaching out to us and showing us their best and that they care. It's nice to know that management takes the comments into consideration whether they are good or bad and they find ways to make it better. The only thing we would recommend is that the television sets might need to be updated, but other than that, everything else was great! We have finally found a good hotel to visit every year when we go on vacation to the Toronto area and we will tell all of our friends about it. We are glad that they proved me wrong and showed us that they really are fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for an airport stopover.”
Reviews.Author: CarrigeenYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on two separate occasions in June on stopovers, and enjoyed both times equally. The rooms were very comfortable, and the two room suite we had was well furnished and decorated, including a fridge and coffee machine. We took our meals in the restaurant downstairs and were very happy with the variety and prices. Be aware that you get a percentage discount in the Restaurant (which is run by a different company) if you are staying in the hotel, so check with the reception when you arrive. I think the voucher was inside the room key folder! We missed out the first time round as we werent told about it! There is free interent in the reception area, but only one computer, so you may have to wait a while if the hotel is busy. There is a good airport shuttle (book ahead) but you have to pay 6 dollars, refundable at the desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great food and wonderful service .... and a great location”
Reviews.Author: pattiandmarty
Reviews.Content: We were married October, 2009. On the Friday evening before the wedding, we had a dinner party for 100 people at the hotel. The service, food, and attention to detail by the staff was outstanding. We did not have to decorate the private room as they furnished enough decorations to make it festive. Most of our out-of-town guests (over 100) stayed at the hotel. They all commented on how much they liked the hotel. The location is outstanding (near the airport and just off 401 with easy access to downtown and for arriving guests). We would recommend this hotel (and have) to anyone coming into Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “This is a neat, clean hotel and generally...”
Reviews.Author: aysr
Reviews.Content: This is a neat, clean hotel and generally good value for the money especially if you have a car. If you don't have a car it gets a bit inconvenient to get into town. You can take the airport shuttle to the airport and take the TTC "rocket" bus 192 into the Kipling subway station. At this point you can get pretty much anywhere in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Shorty808
Reviews.Content: My Dad and I stayed here on 21Jul10, for one night. Check in was easy, parking was close, the elevators were always available. We had a room with two beds, and a kitchenette. Everything was clean and the room was spacious. The price was awesome for what we were paying for. The airport shuttle runs 24 hours a day. We were told to come down at 3:45 to be at the airport for 4am. We came down 20 minutes early and the driver was waiting for us. He took our bags, loaded them and helped unload them when we got to the airport. Very awesome hotel, definitely a good price, would reccommend it for anyone who needed an airport hotel. :)

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Place”
Reviews.Author: tuko53
Reviews.Content: I plan a annual major conference at a local confernece centre and need housing for a significant number of colleagues and I've used Quality Suties Toronto Airport for three successive years and plan to continue doing so. Even before seeing the hotel I was sold on it because of the helpfulness of the staff over the phone. Upon arriving the staff proved to be even more helpful, answered all my questions and did everything possible to ensure that my guests would receive the best service. The suites were just what I needed because they were clean, spacious, comfortable and the staff made sure that I was able to receive the number I requested. Even before I surveyed my guests, they spontaneously told me how impressed they were with the hotel and the staff and wanted to know if they would be returning to it the following year. So, for the past three years I used Quality Suites Toronto and my guests consider it to be a 'home from home' experience. It provides the perfect place at a very competitive rate. And of course, being so close to the airport just makes it the automatic choice for the business traveller and visitor to the city alike. It's defintiely a thumbs up for me! Halsey Peat Director of Communications, Ontario Conference of Seventh-day Adventists

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: Crystal35
Reviews.Content: Our womens hockey team has stayed at this hotel for the past 4 years and have enjoyed the huge rooms and wonderful customer service. It's great location is close to restaurants and the arenas that we play in. There is a lot of parking for vehicles and guests. We look forward to returning every year.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Hotel for Hockey Teams”
Reviews.Author: CoachBrian
Reviews.Content: The best Toronto hotel for minor hockey teams. Queen Suites offer great room value, comfort and space. Full buffet breakfast is included with cost. Highly recommended...no hotel matches the quality and value for teams on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: firstchild3
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay when you have a large group of people. The beds were comfortable and the staff were pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “YUK-will not stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: malomotts
Reviews.Content: Some of the highlights of our stay at this awful hotel: -half carton of milk in refrigerator left from previous guests!!! -rude employees -All light bulbs except one didn't work -no kleenex in box no toilet paper -remotes didn't work -noise in bathroom pipes/ something was rattling all night long -Stains on bed I spoke to the manger the next day who would not switch us to another room because they were booked. We have traveled all over the world and have had better service in rinky dink hotels than this one on Carlingview. There are so many hotels in that location choose a different one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: JackLondon_Ontario
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my elderly parents (2 rooms) prior to a vacation. Everything about this stay was positive. The convenience of the two room layout of each suite was most welcome. The hotel offered everything you would expect or need from a larger hotel but on an intimate level. Travelling with seniors, it was imperative that everything was close at hand. The proximity of the lobby, elevators and parking garage was very close and convenient. We had dinner in the restaurant, Grafittis, and it was excellent. As well, the Quality Suites was close enough to the airport to be extremely convenient without the noise of the airplanes. Oh . . . and the beds, VERY comfortable (a big deal for me).

Reviews.Title: “QS was the perfect place for my Band!”
Reviews.Author: Musician1_10
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Quality Suites Toronto, with my Grade 8 Band students, and our parent-supervisors. In every way, our stay was perfect! The check-in process was quick and efficient; the rooms were all ready...clean and on time; the rooms were large and comfortable; the was free parking for our bus; students were treated respectfully, and like 'real customers'; extra towels and shampoo were provided promptly and without grumbling; our (included) breakfast was served promptly and with courtesy, and was delicious; the check-out process was painless! In short, this was the perfect place for us to stay, on our annual band trip. We plan on returning!

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Pitts_Anonymous
Reviews.Content: Travelled here twice for hockey tournaments. The staff is always accomodating to both the kids who attend and the parents (who pay)! Helpful with directions, exchange rates, and recommendations for local dining. This place is a definite value.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: jtownchief7
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on a recomendation from other teams that have stayed in the past, We have travelled as a group/team for several years and we honestly look forward to returning to the Quality Suites in Toronto for the first class service, friendly staff and overall customer satisfaction. The price is just right for everything we recieved, will not hesitate to return with the family or another hockey team.

Reviews.Title: “By far the best place to bring a hockey team”
Reviews.Author: Roym44
Reviews.Content: I have book hockey teams here for the last two years, Service was just the best, food is very good. They want your bussiness and show it

Reviews.Title: “THE RIGHT PLACE, IN THE RIGHT LOCATION, AND GREAT SERVICE TOO!”
Reviews.Author: DREAMSTAKEFLIGHT
Reviews.Content: Just minutes from the Toronto International Airport. Ongoing shuttle service. Very hospitable and accommodating staff. The hotel hosts its own restaurant, with good food and good service. Surrounded by other very interesting places in the area to visit and dine too. 30 minutes from Downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel staff around”
Reviews.Author: cantravelHamilton
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel and host a lot of my customers. The hotel staff is very halpful and always friendly. The hotel is well taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “My preferred place to stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: pfrederick
Reviews.Content: Always a great place to stay! Great restaurant on premises. Well maintained, clean, comfortable suites, with all the amenities required for business. I have been staying here for years and I have never been able to find a better bang for the buck anywhere in Toronto. Feels like home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “A great location with very good amenities. Staff is very accommodating.”
Reviews.Author: dingle2010
Reviews.Content: I have found Quality Suites, Toronto Airport, to be a very convenient location for my event held at the International Convention Centre. Staff has always been accommodating and friendly. Wait staff for the restaurant and for catered events aim to please. The Sales Management consistent in their service and provide excellent service. I would recommend the Quality Suites as very good value for the accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “No Better Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: belleville_10
Reviews.Content: Late check in due to traffic delays. Front desk very accommodating and sympathetic of our later arrival. Graffiti's restaurant provided us with a great late dinner at a reasonable price. Suite easily accommodated our family with a king size bed as well as a queen bed and double pull-out for our two adult children. The room was quiet and comfortable and we awoke well rested for our next day's travel. Airport Shuttle the next morning was on time and left us with plenty of time once we got to Pearson. Upon return to Toronto, the Shuttle dropped us off at the hotel wher we found our vehicle safe and sound. Hotel is perfectly situated for ready access to the airport as well as the 400 series of highways. A must stay location for travellers and visitors to the city. Thank you Quality Suites Toronto Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: flippity
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretty good we stayed here on March 28th for one night when we had to pass through Toronto to get to Cancun for Manitobas spring break. Despite our experience at the Airport our luggege never showed up and the hotels shuttle bus took about 30 Minutes to come. Our lat landing 6:45 flight and that bad stuff at the Airport meant we got our hotel at 9:15 PM and ended up having dinner in the hotels resraunt called the Quality restraunt the food was great and the service is friendly and the lady who worked at the restraunt evan told us whats for breakfast the next morning.The rooms were spotless very clean and the walls were thick enough so we didint here the people next store. The rooms only had a very noisey coffe maker and no fridge or Microwave and the TV is small and bad picture. The beds are clean and crisp but the blanket was etier too hot or too cold and the pillows are a bit thick thats why I had a resfull sleep. We got a 7:00 wake up call for a 10:00 flight. The halls are dark and dirty and the ript up carpet.The breakfast was not that good the Tea biscuts and sausage was horbal the bagels were bad as well.The shuttle bus was okay the driver was friendly there was lots of cargo space and comfy seats but the bus should come to the Airport more often. Tyler age 10.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for airport access”
Reviews.Author: Canadian079
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel near the Toronto airport due to its price, the fact that it served a complimentary full hot breakfast and provided a free shuttle bus to and from the airport. Driving with family to the hotel took about fifteen minutes. Check-in was efficient and friendly. We checked out their restaurant for dinner but it serves mostly finger foods and hamburger style meals. So instead we drove the nearby Swiss Chalet on Dixon Road. The room we were give was quite large and tastefully appointed. It was nice and quiet â€“ with no internal noise but a bit of freeway sound once in a while. The bathroom was well equipped with soap and shampoo. It was also very clean. We needed an early morning wake up call and had breakfast as soon as the restaurant opened at 6:30. The breakfast though was a disappointment. We were e-mailed from the hotel that it was a full hot breakfast with eggs. This day there were no eggs. There was cereal, various breads and bagels and fruit. In other words an enhanced continental breakfast. They should either prepare what they market or they should rebrand the breakfast to a continental one. The shuttle left right at seven and we were dropped off at Terminal one about fifteen minutes later. We chose this hotel for its proximity to the airport, for its complimentary shuttle and breakfast and its reasonable rate. Every thing was fine except the breakfast. We would certainly recommend this hotel for its cleanliness, service and room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay before Jamaican trip..”
Reviews.Author: JamaicanDaisy
Reviews.Content: and we have no real complaints. The size of the room is nice, beds were SUPER comfortable and it is close to the airport. The shuttle is $6 per person, which I found odd since all the other Pearson Airport hotels seem to have a free shuttle. Good for a one night stay, but not too sure about staying there longer. All in all, a decent place to stay. We got a really good price on Hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good!”
Reviews.Author: AngusMac
Reviews.Content: We got a great price on this hotel for one night via a website where you pay first and find out the hotel name later - less than $70. After reading past few reviews, I wasn't expecting much. But what a surprise! Only about 5 minutes away from YYZ by shuttle, this hotel offers a clean, quiet, roomy one bedroom suite with nice modern furniture. There's a work desk, lots of storage space, a comfortable king size bed, a dressing area, and a kitchen with a small fridge, microwave, coffee maker and sink. Plus not one but two TV's (one in each section). What more could you ask of a stop-over airport hotel? We were only here for about 5 hours, but I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall reasonably nice, with a few irritating quirks”
Reviews.Author: lucy_2234
Reviews.Content: Overall I found the hotel to be comfortable and my room was (mostly) clean. The bed was comfortable and the suite was quite roomy, with a great bathroom - I really liked the double doors. For bad points, the suite only included a minibar area with a tiny fridge with a door that would not stay closed and therefore wasn't at all cold - I had to use the ice machines (which were only on every other floor, not on the floor that I was staying on, and didn't always work) to keep the drinks I bought cold. The fridge also leaked water all over the floor in front of it one day. When I checked in, there was food left in the fridge from the previous occupant that I had to throw away - luckily it didn't smell. And, while attempting to get the fridge door to close properly (which never did happen), I shifted the tiny fridge and discovered a previous occupant (I hope, and not a staff member) had left behind a little "gift" in the form of a porn magazine! Good thing it was found by me and not a family with a child, I guess. The stay was paid by the company hosting the seminar that I attended (in the hotel - the seminar room was spacious and comfortable and the catered breakfast and lunches were exceptional), so that was good, but I don't know that I would come back if I had to pay on my own. A few fellow attendees were disappointed by the lack of a pool on-site, and the "high-speed" internet was anything but, unfortunately - even the paid service was slow and spotty.

Reviews.Title: “A reasonable hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: kcowan
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel offering great prices and I was staying to settle my borther's estate and sell his house so was there for 20 days. What is good: -location is close to the airport (cheap shuttle every half hour) -on a main bus route ($2.75 anywhere in Toronto, $1.85 for seniors) -the route 58 bus goes directly to the subway in 35 minutes -Graffitti Italian restaurant on-site is excellent -there are many other dining choices within a short walk -tuck shop provides for quick snacks -suite provides large bedroom with TV and queen-sized bed -french doors separate bedroom from living area -living area has office with leather chair and 2 side chairs -sofa in front of second TV turns into another bed -bar area with stocked coffee maker, sink and fridge, daily coffee -separate make up table area with iron and board -2 cupboards -windows that open -plenty of drawers for storage What could be better -microwave would increase utility of the suite -cupboards in the bar area for storing food items -foam plastic cups and wrapped in plastic with holes in it -internet is wired only and supplied cable is short -DataValet service inadequate for serious internet users [--] -TVs and reception are substandard -parking charge per day -phone charges for local calls -room repair: pull rod for drapes not connected, smoke detector falling off, bathtub plug hard to use -sometimes coffee not replenished daily

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: mi2boiz
Reviews.Content: I actually won a nights stay at this hotel and my family and I had an enjoyable and relaxing time. Check in & check out was quick and easy and the staff was pleasant and helpful. Please be aware that parking is an additional $15 charge and there is also a charge to make a local call. It's in an ideal location; about 5 minutes from the airport, 20 minutes from downtown Toronto and 10 minutes from the closest shopping mall. The room was very spacious and comfortable and very clean. Because the rooms are all suites, they come with a mini fridge and coffee maker and some rooms come with a microwave as well (upon request). We enjoyed their comfy beds and had a great nights sleep. The hotel restaurant Graffiti's is on the premises and offers great Italian-inspired food at reasonable prices. If you would like to travel to other restaurants in the area, there are plenty of them north of the hotel along Hwy 27. All in all, I would recommend this hotel to friends and family

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value - Unparallel service”
Reviews.Author: Francos-Duf
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located near the airport and offers a free shuttle service. There is an in-house restaurant/pub which is convenient, clean and which offers good food selection. Otherwise, you are only a short cab ride away from a multi restaurant complex. (Milestones, Kelseys, etc...). Although not fancy, the executive suites are roomy and offer newer TV's and a large work area which often comes in handy. What makes this hotel special has to be the at-home atmosphere they create for repeat visitors. As I' ve stayed there on numerous occasions over the last 4 years, I can attest to the fact that all employees are always friendly and go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. On some occasions, they even went beyond strictly carrying out hotel related responsibilities as they assisted in resolving personal matters. For that as well as for the value/price ratio, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and so close to YYZ Toronto Int'l”
Reviews.Author: OceanB333
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a stop-over and had a suite (all rooms are suites) which had a separate king size bedroom (french doors), a pull-out sofa bed, large table/desk for eating and working, free wired hi-speed internet. The bed was extremely comfortable, with many pillows, nice decor, and impeccably clean. The reception staff were very friendly and attentive, except for one (perhaps she was having a bad day). There is also a computer for use in the lobby. Room service; had a pasta and salad meal which, unfortunately, did not agree with me. All in all, would stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Do you like air freshener smell?”
Reviews.Author: Afellow
Reviews.Content: I booked several rooms in this hotel. I started with the Web site that did not work well. After entering all the info, I was brought back to the initial page and no reservation had been done. I then called their reservation line, this was fortunate because they immediately offered me a rate that was $22 less expensive! But a couple of days later, on a Sunday, I was called at home by some person in what she said was an effort to improve the image of the hotel. I had to tell her that a good way to start was not to bother people, I don't do free consulting for hotels on Sundays (slam phone, I had other priorities!). When I arrived at the hotel, unfortunately the first thing I noticed upon entering the room was a very strong smell of air freshner. I thought: good my wife is not here, she would refuse to enter. After I got back home, my clothes still had that smell! The room was otherwise acceptable. I slept all right, but the other colleagues who were in other rooms complained of not having been able to sleep well, I wonder if the odor was the culprit. An inexpensive hotel, however you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Rates & Guest Services”
Reviews.Author: MyattMD
Reviews.Content: This is about the 8th time I've stayed here and we have never had a problem, but this time the rate is ASTRONOMICAL. We even had multiple rooms booked for the family. Anyway, we payed $156 bucks to stay here. When I checked the rates on expedia and other websites, it's 100 bucks today. When I contacted the front desk they said that the rates fluctuate and too bad. I called choice hotels customer service, they also said too bad, then tried to sell me something or enter me in some kind of chance to win something. 50 bucks is a big difference, at least to me. Needless to say, we won't be staying here or at choice hotels again.

Reviews.Title: “Problem After Problem..”
Reviews.Author: ChinoLoco
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at this property, we were pleasantly surprised to find out that there was covered parking for our Park and Fly Package. That was pretty much the only good thing about this location. We checked in (which took a little bit too long considering nobody else was checking in at the same time and the staff didn't completely understand English) and were given keys to a 1 room suite. Great! .. Except it was DIRTY. The bed was unmade and there was GARBAGE everwhere in the room. After making a call to the front desk, they changed our room. This room was at least clean, however, the sink was broken. ** Be warned that the walls are paper thin at this property and you can hear what is happening at the party 4 rooms down. People were throwing up in the hallways and ours was littered with pizza boxes and empty cases of beer. ** Bedding was quite comfortable at this hotel and the suites are well proportioned. You will have to pay for the shuttle TO and FROM the airport. There are many other properties in this area that offer complimentary shuttles to Pearson International Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice beds, needs decorating”
Reviews.Author: chuftyboy
Reviews.Content: Beds were very comfortable, rooms good size and facilities good. Decor of the place is very scruffy, internet didn't work in room and the public computer was permanently occupied by teenagers.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marlowgirl
Reviews.Content: Let's face it - when you are traveling on business, all you want at the end of the day is to sleep. I challenge you to sleep with the thread bare bedding and the rock hard pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Still Run-down”
Reviews.Author: BlvlTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple years ago and was so bad I complained. Got it again through priceline (thought it was a 2 star and could avoid with a 2.5 star bid - apparently priceline bought into the renovation = additional 1/2 star argument). As mentioned, web site said they'd renovated so had high hopes..... Apparently renos mean new wallpaper. The carpets are still worn, the walls still have holes in them, the furinture still sags. The rooms are large, with 2 beds usually, but bizarrely no desk, so bit lousy as a business traveller. Internet is available via cable only, so you have to sit on edge of very low, worn couch and crouch down to do work. Parking is an additional 10$, there is an overpriced restaurant on bottom floor (sandwiches around 10-12, main courses 16 and up). The fitness room has some classic 80s cardio equipment and a cable, pulley resistance machine. Service remains somewhat surly and inattentive. All in all, still a low budget hotel. Go for the Travelodge across the road if ou're looking for same price range. Service is better, rooms a bit less worn and free parking (wireless is pay per use I think though).

Reviews.Title: “Not for families”
Reviews.Author: Zion
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Quality for 5 nights 2 adults and 2 kids. Room was very small, not comfortable (no space for toiletry bag in bathroom!), clean. In our room we did not have things we needed traveling with little baby (microwave, fridge, ..). Location is next to nothing. Parking is on the back and you have to walk around building to get into lobby. Very uncomfortable. Electronic key was not working on second day. Had to reprogram it. Service was fine, particularly in the hotel bar. Donâ€™t expect anything fancy in this hotel. Overall the Quality is good choice only for a business traveler or for overnight in the airport area, but nothing else.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good value-like the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: SueKA
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel after a vacation flight. A friend booked it so we didn't get the excellent park and fly deal they have. The parking lot was jampacked and there was hardly anywhere to park on the premises. The front entry is not easy for moving luggage in and out because it has steps, so go around to the side. There are no bellhops and maybe one luggage cart, but the front desk staff is personable and helpful. However, the suite was quite nice and the restaurant has a good variety and quality for decent prices. I'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great space for "Clean Low price Place!"”
Reviews.Author: highlandsally
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay for the price! We booked through the Quality Suites own web site. They included breakfast in the price. A great breakfast at that! Parking is not included as stated on Expedia. Cost to park was $10.00 CAD a night with in and out priviledges. Lots of room, great "new pillowtop matresses", clean, and with maid service to write home about! Would stay there again as it is very conveinient to shopping, airport and major highways. Lots of eateries within 10 minute or less walking distance. (Lone Star, Coffee Time, The Keg, Arizona's, Pat & Mario's, +++ The hotel's own restaurant is also very good. "Highlandsally" from Brighton, ON.

Reviews.Title: “Stopover hotel.......don't stop...”
Reviews.Author: warminup
Reviews.Content: We used the park & fly package. Rooms: Cold looking, cheaply decorated, but clean ! We didn't have heat in our room all night. We had basically just walked into the room and went right to bed as we had gotten in late & had an early morning flight. My husband was sound asleep beside me while I shivvered & froze all night. He could sleep standing up in a phone booth. There was no use in calling the front desk, as it was late, husband was sleeping and it was the middle of the night.........we couldn't move to another room. Park & Fly: You have to go down the road & take your own vehicle there. We returned to find, our brand new vehicle 'crammed' in beside others, with no room to even open our doors (how did they get it there????)and our window was left down 4 inches ???? Wasn't warmed which they advertise. I would stay across the street at the Travelodge next time. You park in their attatched parking lot, and the rooms are very homey & nice for the same price as the hassle at the Quality Suites. Stayed at TL before, and should of stuck with it.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely laid-out, well-maintained suites”
Reviews.Author: archipelago
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a cross-country trip. We had made a reservation through Priceline for $40. The hotel was much nicer than we expected and a great bargain at that price; separate bedroom, king size bed plus couch folding out into another bed, very quiet and free high speed internet. Beware that parking may be additional.

Reviews.Title: “Nice / Clean / Large 2.5* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: balti_less
