Reviews.Content: Nice 2.5* hotel with large size suites. Very clean room with a bedroom separated by two french doors. There is a large sofa bed with coffee table and a small dining table with four chairs. No fridge nor microwave which would have been nice. There is a minibar but could not really use it to store larger items. Lots of closet space. One in entry area and one in the bedroom. Plenty of parking which is charged daily. Definitely need a car to be in this area. Very close to the airport, and major highways like 401 and 427. Woodbine Casino and race track was also a close driving distance. Large coffee shop was next door. Other restaurants located in hotels surrounding the area. No problems with the hotel. Very quiet, but the HVAC unit was loud initially, but got used to the loud fan after one night, Room I had overlooked a now vacant Regal Constellation Hotel. Not a pretty sight, but the other side of the building did not have a nice view either (parking garage and more parking lots). Definitely a good value if won through Priceline. Wouldn't mind staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked the room on a website which stated that it was a 2.5 star. So I did not expect much. I got there and was pleasantly surprized turns out be have 3 diamond rating, and the suite was huge. Seperate living room, with dinning room table, pull out couch, king master bedroom, mini bar with sink and fridge. The room was very clean, and the maids were nice and not intrusive. You wouldn't beleive how many times they have just walked into the room because we forget the "do not disturb" sign at other hotels. The only complaint is that the room over looked an adult club, with "interesting" pictures on it. I guess they can't help that. This hotel made a great weekend even better.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some work”
Reviews.Author: thunderingfox
Reviews.Content: Stayed in hotel Jan 20-21, 2005. Lovely rooms with a nice layout for a family and very clean however two major problems. The first was the food in the restaurant for both breakfasts and supper was really poor. Bacon on caesar salad was semi-raw and sausages at breakfast tasted uncooked. Other diners felt the same way. It felt like the cook was away. The second problem was, due a cold snap, there was an inch of ice on the inside of the hotel windows and a pile of snow in the conference room. Also the temperature of the front lobby and restaurant remained at about 40 degrees Fahrenheit my entire stay. I'd go back but not during cold weather and I would avoid the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel before vacation flight”
Reviews.Author: ricklee
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as we had an early flight and needed to park the car while we were gone for eight days. The free shuttle to the airport was smooth and trouble free. I wont tell you the rate we paid for the room but it was very reasonable and included free parking while we were gone. When we returned to the airport we simply called the hotel and they sent the van right over. We will not need to use park n fly again.

Reviews.Title: “when in toronto”
Reviews.Author: solace
Reviews.Content: quality inn suites is a good place to stay even if there is a little aircraft noise at times. the suites are very spacious with comfortable furnishings, although the bed was a little too firm for my taste. it was handy having two televisions, one in the lounge and one in the bedroom, as my husband and i like different programmes so there was no arguments over the remote control. reception staff were friendly and efficient. due to its location i feel a car is necessary. would certainly stay at quality suites again.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: bbilodeau55
Reviews.Content: When I called the hotel my original price quoted was $133.00, after I said I had CAA the price dropped to $103.00. That was a great rate for a suite. The hotel was clean, updated, quiet and the room was spacious. Just across the street from the Keg, I would definately stay again. Not good for kids, no pool.

HotelInfo.Name: Quality Suites Toronto Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 262 Carlingview Dr., Toronto, Ontario M9W 5G1, Canada
